intro: Patania concinna, commonly known as the slender patania, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in spring, followed by small, round fruits. It is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
